business.headline: Diwali 2025: From ETFs to SGBs, 5 smart ways to invest in goldWith gold prices at record levels this Diwali, many people are rethinking whether to buy jewellery or look at smarter investment routes. From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Buying just gold on Dhanteras? Why you should consider a mutual fund SIPAs Dhanteras's theme shifts from gold to goal-based investing, here is a detailed guide to help investors make smarter, purpose-driven financial choices this festive season.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

IMF chief says open trade key for India's continued economic riseIMF Director Kristalina Georgieva said that India stands out as one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and continues to make a major contribution to global growth because of its consistent reform efforts.

Canara HSBC Life listing today: What GMP hints about its debut on Dalal StreetThe IPO of Canara HSBC Life Insurance Company Limited was a book-built issue worth Rs 2,517.50 crore. It was entirely an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 23.75 crore shares.

Azoria CEO alleges ETF delisted after refusing to back firms hiring H-1B workersAzoria Capital's CEO alleges that his statement -- vowing not to invest in companies that replace American workers with H-1Bs -- led to a sudden move by the Board of Trustees of Tidal Trust III to delist the Azoria 500 Meritocracy ETF, a fund launched earlier this year.

Diwali Muhurat Trading 2025: Date, time and everything investors must knowThis year's Muhurat Trading will take place on Tuesday, October 21, 2025. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm.
Lost job? Here's how much PF you can withdraw under new EPFO rulesEPFO said the change is meant to safeguard retirement savings while still allowing access during tough times.
Infosys announces Rs 23 interim dividend. Check record date, payout detailsInfosys sweetened investor sentiment this Dhanteras week with a robust quarterly performance and a Rs 23 interim dividend.

Infosys Q2 profit rises 13% to Rs 7,364 crore; declares Rs 23 interim dividendInfosys revised the lower end of its full-year revenue guidance upward to 2–3%, compared with 1–3% earlier, reflecting cautious optimism amid a challenging global IT environment. The operating margin forecast for FY26 was retained at 20–22%.
Sensex ends 862 points higher, Nifty above 25,600; Titan up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 862.23 points to end at 83,467.66, while the NSE Nifty50 added 261.75 points to close at 25,585.30.

entertainment.headline: Did this old KBC ad predict viral Ishit Bhatt episode with Amitabh Bachchan? Watch Ten-year-old Ishit Bhatt's confident yet controversial appearance on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has gone viral, drawing parallels with a three-year-old 'KBC' ad that predicted the moment. As writer Neeraj Singh's old script turns into real life, the incident has sparked a wider debate on parenting and children's behaviour.

Did Victoria's Secret models walk to this Kamal Haasan song? Read here A mashup featuring the Bollywood song 'Tere Mere Beech Mein' and Britney Spears' 'Toxic' was played during the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show 2025 in New York City. The combination attracted attention, highlighting the song's influence and musical connection.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan praises Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1 success Amitabh Bachchan commends Rishab Shetty and team for their work on 'Kantara: Chapter 1' on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17. The film, produced by Hombale Films, explores the origins and mythology of Kantara in the 4th Century AD.

Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana Bhatt chose captaincy over compassion. So what? Farrhana Bhatt's captaincy move in 'Bigg Boss 19' -- shredding Neelam's letter to stay in power -- has split the house and viewers alike. But was she really wrong, or just bold enough to play the villain on her own terms? Here's a look at how her unapologetic choice exposed the hypocrisy inside the house.

After Zubeen Garg's death, Brahmaputra Valley Film Festival pushed to 2026 The Brahmaputra Valley Film Festival has been postponed to 2026 following Zubeen Garg's death. Five individuals, including close associates of Garg, have been sent to judicial custody amid an investigation.

Arjun Bijlani on Rise & Fall win: Was initially scared but being real helped me Arjun Bijlani wins Rise and Fall after 42 days of tough challenges. His authentic gameplay and emotional journey won hearts across India. In an exclusive chat, the actor reflects on his journey and how being real helped him on the show.

Liam Payne's girlfriend shares emotional tribute on his first death anniversary The one-year anniversary of Liam Payne's death was marked by tributes from his girlfriend, fans, and family. The former One Direction member is being remembered for his music and lasting influence.

The Diplomat Season 3 review: Keri Russell anchors a tense tale of power and painRelease Date:Thu Oct 16, 2025 Creator Debora Cahn delivers a sharp, emotionally charged portrait of power, politics, and vulnerability, led by Keri Russell and Rufus Sewell at their finest. As alliances shift and loyalties crumble, 'The Diplomat Season 3' asks—can love and duty truly coexist? Here's our review.

Ed Sheeran's new EP Play includes songs with Karan Aujla, Hanumankind, Dhee, more Ed Sheeran has infused his latest EP 'Play' with a global flavour by collaborating with renowned South Asian artists including Hanumankind, Dhee, Arijit Singh, Karan Aujla, Santhosh Narayanan, and Jonita Gandhi.

Adhyashree Upadhyay dedicates Super Dancer 5 win to Zubeen Garg, meets his father Adhyashree Upadhyay, joint winner of Sony TV's Super Dancer Chapter 5, visited the father of late singer Zubeen Garg after her win. She dedicated her win to the late music icon.

Arasan promo: Silambarasan in dual roles, Vetri Maaran expands Vada Chennai universe The first 'Arasan' promo, directed by Vetri Maaran and featuring Silambarasan TR in a dual role, has debuted online. It offers a gritty peek into the 'Vada Chennai' universe.

Arjun Bijlani wins Rise & Fall, takes home Rs 28 lakh; Aarush Bhola first runner-up Arjun Bijlani has won the reality show 'Rise & Fall', with Aarush Bhola and Arbaz Patel finishing as first and second runners-up. The finale, hosted by Ashneer Grover, features six top contenders.

Kantara box office Day 14: Rishab Shetty film rules all markets, enters 3rd weekend Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' continues its unstoppable box office run, earning Rs 476.4 crore nett in 14 days across all languages. With massive collections in Hindi and Kannada, the mythological action film is now eyeing the Rs 500 crore mark as it enters its third weekend.

YouTuber MrBeast meets SRK, Salman, Aamir in Riyadh, sparks buzz over a collab YouTube sensation MrBeast recently shared a photo with Bollywood superstars Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Aamir Khan, sparking excitement among Indian fans. His caption hinting at a possible collaboration has set social media abuzz with speculation.
Sonakshi Sinha trolls pregnancy rumours with witty post Actor Sonakshi Sinha gave a witty reply to pregnancy rumours along with a post celebrating Diwali. Take a look at the post here.

Diesel review: promising premise lost in weak executionRelease Date:Fri Oct 17, 2025 Diesel movie review: Director Shanumugam Muthusamy 'Diesel', starring Harish Kalyan, Vinay Rai and Athulya Ravi, is a film that aims to tell the story of a fisher folk in the problems in the world of crude oil. The film lacks originality despite its length to mount the film on a huge canvas.

Britney Spears' ex claims she did cocaine while breastfeeding sons, singer hits back Kevin Federline's upcoming memoir alleges shocking incidents during his marriage to Britney Spears, including claims of drug use while breastfeeding. Spears has strongly denied these accusations and shared her journey towards healing and personal growth.

Ace Frehley, original KISS guitarist and rock icon, dies at 74 Ace Frehley, the original lead guitarist of the iconic rock band KISS, has died at 74. Renowned for his electrifying guitar solos and signature 'Spaceman' persona, Frehley helped define KISS's signature sound and larger-than-life stage presence, leaving behind a lasting legacy in rock music.

Rishab Shetty celebrates Kantara success with prayers at Chamundeshwari Temple Rishab Shetty visited the Chamundeshwari and Srikanteshwara Temples to express gratitude after 'Kantara: Chapter 1' blockbuster success. Calling the film's triumph a divine blessing, he plans to continue his spiritual journey with a visit to the Murudeshwari Temple in Bihar.

general news.headline:
They know all because they're Infosys? Siddaramaiah slams Murthys over caste surveyKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah hit back at Infosys founder NR Narayana Murthy and author Sudha Murty for skipping the state's Social and Educational Survey, saying, "Just because they're Infosys, do they know it all?"
He reiterated the exercise was for the entire population, not just backward classes.

Big Gujarat reshuffle, Harsh Sanghavi is Deputy Chief Minister, 19 fresh facesThe BJP government in Gujarat expanded its council of ministers to 25, elevating Harsh Sanghavi as Deputy Chief Minister and inducting Rivaba Jadeja, alongside a mix of returning and first-time ministers.

Return to your 'I hate India' tour: US singer trolls Rahul Gandhi over PM remarkUS singer Mary Millben defended PM Modi, saying he is not afraid of Trump and critiqued Rahul Gandhi's leadership. She told Gandhi to return to his "I hate India" tour, amid his allegations that PM Modi allowed the US to dictate India's Russian oil policy.

Why '93000' is trending amid videos of Taliban parading pants of Pak soldiersAfghanistan-Pakistan Conflict: While both Pakistan and Afghanistan have claimed the other blinked first, videos of Taliban fighters displaying trousers, allegedly of Pakistani soldiers who fled their posts, have ensured that Afghanistan is atleast winning the narrative war on social media.

KBC 17's Ishit Bhatt vs Arunoday: The ideal child war, and Sharma Ji Ka Beta momentWhen 'KBC 17's' Ishit Bhatt was criticised for being 'rude', the internet found a new favourite in Arunoday -- turning childhood into a comparison contest. The 'Sharma Ji Ka Beta' moment got real, exposing how adults pit children against each other in the name of ideals.

Super-secret Peace Bridge map and why Russia has given JFK files to US nowRussia has handed over a super-secret Soviet-era file to the US on President JF Kennedy's assassination. The file has a map of a Cold War-era-planned Peace Bridge to connect the two countries. Why did Moscow release the JFK file now, and can it shake up geopolitics?

Bengaluru student rapes senior on college campus, later asks if she needs pillA Bengaluru junior student allegedly raped his senior inside a private engineering college. The accused, Jeevan Gowda, was arrested and remanded. Police are investigating amid lack of CCTV, analysing digital and physical evidence.

Siddaramaiah's 'world record' moment goes bust as social media users fact checkAfter the Karnataka Chief Minister posted certificates from the London Book of World Records touting world record achievements for the Shakti Scheme and KSRTC, social media users quickly discovered that the certifying company had been dissolved in the UK months earlier, sparking accusations of a fake or doctored award.

Liquor baron, secret meetings: When RSS ignored BJP, helped Congress win electionAfter Indira Gandhi's assassination, Rajiv Gandhi reportedly had a secret meeting with then RSS chief Balasaheb Deoras, resulting in its cadre supporting the Congress in the 1984 Lok Sabha elections despite the BJP's presence. There were at least six secret meetings between Sangh members and the party, including one at the residence of liquor baron Kapil Mohan. The Congress registered the biggest-ever Lok Sabha election victory.

Did this old KBC ad predict viral Ishit Bhatt episode with Amitabh Bachchan? WatchTen-year-old Ishit Bhatt's confident yet controversial appearance on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has gone viral, drawing parallels with a three-year-old 'KBC' ad that predicted the moment. As writer Neeraj Singh's old script turns into real life, the incident has sparked a wider debate on parenting and children's behaviour.

Priyanka Chopra's red-hot look turns up the heat at London Diwali BallPriyanka Chopra mesmerised at the Diwali Ball in a striking red one-shoulder gown, adorned with sequins and a sweeping train. Take a look at the pictures here:

Manoj Bajpayee backing RJD? Actor slams party for sharing doctored videoBihar elections: Actor Manoj Bajpayee, who hails from Bihar, reacted strongly after a doctored video of him endorsing the RJD went viral. The now deleted video was also shared by Tejashwi Yadav.

A VIP problem for Grand Alliance hours before Bihar nomination deadline Live UpdatesBihar elections: A day-long drama played out on Thursday amid reports that Mukesh Sahani would exit the Grand Alliance. However, it was prevented after intervention from the Congress.

Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana Bhatt chose captaincy over compassion. So what?Farrhana Bhatt's captaincy move in 'Bigg Boss 19' -- shredding Neelam's letter to stay in power -- has split the house and viewers alike. But was she really wrong, or just bold enough to play the villain on her own terms? Here's a look at how her unapologetic choice exposed the hypocrisy inside the house.

Thar hits teen on bicycle in Delhi, then reverses and crushes him before fleeingWhen police arrived at the spot after receiving an emergency call, they found the teenager unconscious on the road. He was declared dead upon arrival when rushed to a nearby hospital.

Less than 10 or over 150 seats: Prashant Kishor on his party's chances in Bihar pollsPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party will be contesting all 243 seats of the Bihar Legislative Assembly and has kept a target of 150 seats.

Donald Trump's oil strategyAs the Ukraine war nears the four-year mark, the West is increasingly looking to bleed Russia's oil economy in order to blunt its military ability. And India, among the largest buyers of Russian crude, is caught in the cross-fire.

No foul play suspected yet in Zubeen Garg death, probe underway: Singapore PoliceIn a statement, Singapore Police has said that the investigation into the death of singer Zubeen Garg on September 19, is underway and so far no foul play has been suspected.
'Everyone's at a Diwali party except me'So what if you're not on the guest list - peace, pyjamas, and ladoos sound like a pretty good party too.

Will Nitish Kumar be Bihar Chief Minister if NDA wins? What Amit Shah saidAmit Shah also revealed that after the last assembly elections in 2020, Nitish Kumar had approached Prime Minister Narendra Modi, emphasising that Bihar should have a Chief Minister from the BJP, as it had secured more seats than his party.

Terrorists attack Army camp in Assam, 3 soldiers injuredAccording to defence sources, the militants fired at the Kakopathar Company location from a moving vehicle at around 12.30 am. The troops on duty retaliated immediately, taking due caution to avoid collateral damage to civilian houses in the close vicinity.

Rahul Gandhi meets family of Dalit man lynched in UP, alleges threat to themHariom Valmiki, a Dalit man from Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur, was lynched on October 2 near Jamunapur in Raebareli after villagers mistook him for a thief.

Why a healthy gut could be the missing piece in your conception storyFor years, fertility conversations have revolved around hormones, ovulation cycles, and sperm count. But science is now looking a little lower — into the gut.

Dude Review: Pradeep Ranganathan's eccentric charm keeps the fun rollingRelease Date:Fri Oct 17, 2025Dude movie review: Director Keerthiswaran's 'Dude', starring Pradeep Ranganathan, Mamitha Baiju and Sarathkumar, is a romantic drama about complex relationship dynamics. The film, with an important social message, is absolute fun when it is self-aware.

The Diplomat Season 3 review: Keri Russell anchors a tense tale of power and painRelease Date:Thu Oct 16, 2025Creator Debora Cahn delivers a sharp, emotionally charged portrait of power, politics, and vulnerability, led by Keri Russell and Rufus Sewell at their finest. As alliances shift and loyalties crumble, 'The Diplomat Season 3' asks—can love and duty truly coexist? Here's our review.

sports.headline: James Anderson set to extend career until 2026 with fresh Lancashire contract: Report James Anderson will extend his Lancashire career through the 2026 season, continuing as a key bowler and leader. He remains England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker with a 25-year domestic career.

Sanjay Manjrekar always criticised me…: R Ashwin slams trolling of Harshit Rana Former spinner R Ashwin, speaking on his YouTube show, reiterated his stance against the trolling of Harshit Rana, citing how Sanjay Manjrekar had been one of his fiercest critics but never made personal remarks. Ashwin's comments come just days after Gautam Gambhir hit out at Kris Srikkanth over his statements about the young fast bowler.

Varun Chakravarthy praises Jasprit Bumrah with D Gukesh– Magnus Carlsen analogy India spinner Varun Chakravarthy has praised Jasprit Bumrah, drawing comparisons between him and legendary Chess player Magnus Carlsen, highlighting his unmatched status in cricket.

AIFF issues 15-year commercial rights tender for ISL: What does it include? The AIFF's decision to float a 15-year ISL commercial rights tender aims to end months of uncertainty. The move however, comes after a push from the football clubs in what was a strong-worded letter, blaming AIFF for breaching trust.

Australian batter opens up on testicular cancer fight and cricket comeback Nic Maddinson has revealed his challenging journey through testicular cancer, from surgery to chemotherapy. He hopes sharing his experience encourages others to get checked early and prioritize their health.

Shubman Gill can grow as captain with Rohit-Virat in dressing room: Axar Patel India all-rounder Axar Patel believes the upcoming three-match ODI series in Australia offers Shubman Gill a perfect platform to grow as a skipper, especially with former captains Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli still present in the dressing room to guide him.

Travis Head backs Rohit Sharma for 2027 World Cup, hopes to play alongside him India tour of Australia: Australia opener Travis Head said he is hopeful of seeing Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Head said he hasn't had the opportunity to personally interact with Rohit about his game.

Juventus under investigation by UEFA over financial fair play UEFA has formally notified Serie A club Juventus of a financial probe covering the 2022-23 to 2024–25 seasons, with potential outcomes including fines or restrictions on player registrations for European competitions.

Rohit's viral airport pics motivated him to be healthier and fit: Abhishek Nayar Rohit Sharma transformed his fitness regime after viral airport photos and has shed a lot of weight ahead of India's ODI series against Australia. He's set to mark his return to international cricket after seven months.

Virat Kohli delights Pakistani fan in Australia, signs India and RCB jersey Virat Kohli met a Pakistani fan in Australia and signed India and RCB jerseys ahead of his ODI return. India are set to play a three-match ODI series against Australia beginning on October 19.

Shubman Gill can grow as captain with Rohit-Virat in dressing room: Axar Patel India all-rounder Axar Patel believes the upcoming three-match ODI series in Australia offers Shubman Gill a perfect platform to grow as a skipper, especially with former captains Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli still present in the dressing room to guide him.

Travis Head backs Rohit Sharma for 2027 World Cup, hopes to play alongside him India tour of Australia: Australia opener Travis Head said he is hopeful of seeing Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in the 2027 ODI World Cup. Head said he hasn't had the opportunity to personally interact with Rohit about his game.

Juventus under investigation by UEFA over financial fair play UEFA has formally notified Serie A club Juventus of a financial probe covering the 2022-23 to 2024–25 seasons, with potential outcomes including fines or restrictions on player registrations for European competitions.

Rohit's viral airport pics motivated him to be healthier and fit: Abhishek Nayar Rohit Sharma transformed his fitness regime after viral airport photos and has shed a lot of weight ahead of India's ODI series against Australia. He's set to mark his return to international cricket after seven months.

Virat Kohli delights Pakistani fan in Australia, signs India and RCB jersey Virat Kohli met a Pakistani fan in Australia and signed India and RCB jerseys ahead of his ODI return. India are set to play a three-match ODI series against Australia beginning on October 19.

Two empty years, one chance: Indian football's pause could spark overdue revivalIndia's AFC Asian Cup dreams have ended in disappointment, leaving the next two years largely uncertain. Khalid Jamil and the AIFF now face the challenge of turning this void into a platform for real progress.

Labuschagne replaces injured Cameron Green in Australia's squad for India ODIsAustralia vs India: Marnus Labuschagne has been called up to replace the injured all-rounder Cameron Green in Australia's ODI squad for the three-match series against India.

Rohit's captaincy removal after Champions Trophy surprised me: Matthew HaydenFormer Australia batter Matthew Hayden expressed surprise at Rohit Sharma's removal from ODI captaincy despite leading India to Champions Trophy 2025 triumph.

Watch: Young Virat Kohli fan erupts with joy, runs around after meeting his idolIndia tour of Australia: A young fan erupted in joy and sprinted around after receiving Virat Kohli's autograph in Perth ahead of the first ODI between India and Australia.

Six Kings Slam: Sinner thrashes Djokovic to set up blockbuster final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner will clash with long-time rival Carlos Alcaraz in the final of the lucrative Six Kings Slam exhibition, having continued his dominant run over Novak Djokovic with an emphatic victory.

Should India have fixed Test centers? A deep dive into BCCI's pitch problemIndia seems to have a problem of plenty when it comes to Test venues. As head coach Gautam Gambhir and former spinner R. Ashwin voice their concerns, here's a look at what's not right with having multiple Test centers.

Can Mohammed Siraj step up in Australia and knock on the 2027 World Cup door?AUS vs IND: Mohammed Siraj will lead India's pace attack in the ODI series against Australia, presenting him with a valuable opportunity to reaffirm his credentials in the 50-over format and strengthen his case for the World Cup two years from now.

Djokovic not retiring anytime soon, aims to emulate LeBron James, Ronaldo in 40sSix Kings Slam 2025: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic said that he doesn't intend to retire anytime soon and wants to emulate the likes of LeBron James, Cristiano Ronaldo, and Tom Brady.

Six Kings Slam: Sinner thrashes Djokovic to set up blockbuster final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner will clash with long-time rival Carlos Alcaraz in the final of the lucrative Six Kings Slam exhibition, having continued his dominant run over Novak Djokovic with an emphatic victory.

Should India have fixed Test centers? A deep dive into BCCI's pitch problemIndia seems to have a problem of plenty when it comes to Test venues. As head coach Gautam Gambhir and former spinner R. Ashwin voice their concerns, here's a look at what's not right with having multiple Test centers.

Can Mohammed Siraj step up in Australia and knock on the 2027 World Cup door?AUS vs IND: Mohammed Siraj will lead India's pace attack in the ODI series against Australia, presenting him with a valuable opportunity to reaffirm his credentials in the 50-over format and strengthen his case for the World Cup two years from now.

Djokovic not retiring anytime soon, aims to emulate LeBron James, Ronaldo in 40sSix Kings Slam 2025: Former World No.1 Novak Djokovic said that he doesn't intend to retire anytime soon and wants to emulate the likes of LeBron James, Cristiano Ronaldo, and Tom Brady.

Sri Lanka have identified strengths, weaknesses of South Africa: Nilakshi de SilvaSri Lanka batter Nilakshi de Silva has said that they have identified the strengths and weaknesses of the South Africa side, who are on a three-match winning streak. Nilakshi said that Sri Lanka can beat any team if they can play to their strengths.

Relocating World Cup 2026 matches unlikely despite Donald Trump rhetoric: OrganisersThe organisers of the 2026 World Cup have dismissed concerns, despite comments made by US President Donald Trump about moving matches from cities he doesn't deem safe.

UAE secure qualification to T20 World Cup 2026 as 20-team field gets setThe UAE have booked their spot to the T20 World Cup 2026 with a dominant win over Japan in Oman on Thursday, October 16. UAE's qualification means that the entire field of 20 teams has been set for the tournament next year.

South Africa's Mlaba looks to make Colombo return count in Sri Lanka clashWomen's World Cup: South African spinner Nonkululeko Mlaba said that she's happy to return to Colombo after last playing in the tri-nation series earlier this year when she picked up six wickets from three games.

Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty rues poor batting after Australia lossBangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty blamed inconsistent batting and the absence of key bowlers for their 10-wicket loss to Australia in the Women's World Cup clash on Thursday in Vizag.

Healy creates history with 113 in Australia vs Bangladesh clash: Stats packAlyssa Healy created history with her second consecutive hundred of the Women's World Cup 2025 as she put the Bangladesh bowlers to the sword on Thursday, October 16. Healy continued her fine form and set a few more records with her innings in Vizag.

What is Test Twenty? Cricket's latest format explainedA new format is all set to take the cricketing world by storm as Test Twenty was launched on Thursday, October 16. Backed by the likes of AB de Villiers, Harbhajan Singh and Clive Lloyd, Test Twenty is ready to capture the imagination of the fans.

Polo returns to Delhi: India set to face World No. 1 Argentina after five yearsIndia will take on Argentina on October 25 in New Delhi, marking the return of international polo to India after a five-year hiatus.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
